pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
WADDELL ENGINEERING LTD.
7 CAMBORNE RD., UNIT C
NEPEAN, ON
T 613-596-8798
F 613-596-9699
www.waddelleng.com
PROJECT:
FLOATING SLAB
2510 LINE ROAD 6
BECKWITH, ON
CLIENT:
CONNER BRYDGES
DRAWING TITLE:
NOTES, PLAN & SECTION(S)
DRAWN BY: CC DATE: 2023-01-07
DESIGN BY: NA SHEET NO:
SCALE: AS NOTED S1
PROJECT NO:
25-01-014
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES:
FOUNDATIONS:
1. REMOVE ALL TOPSOIL AND ORGANIC MATERIAL FROM THE BUILDING AREA.
2. SLAB MUST BE ON GRADED DOWN TO NATURAL, UNDISTURBED SOIL, CAPABLE OF SUSTAINING 1500 PSF (75 kPa) PRESSURE UNDER BEARING OF 3000 PSF (150 kPa) (ALL OTHER SUPPORTING SUBSURFACE MATERIAL PRESSURE OF 1500 PSF).
3. IF GRADE TO BE BUILT UP, GRANULAR FILL IS TO BE USED TO A DEPTH OF A MAXIMUM OF 5 FT. FILL IS TO BE COMPACTED TO 98% MODIFIED PROCTOR DENSITY.
4. ENGINEERING SOIL AND DRAINAGE FOLLOWING EXCAVATION, AND FOUNDATION DESIGN BASED ON CONDITIONS PROVIDED BY CLIENT.
5. UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED, IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING/HEAVING (EVEN IF BUILDING IS NOT HEATED) DUE TO HEAT LOSS OF BUILDING IF HEATED.
6. IF NOT INSTALLED OR NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING.
7. IF SLAB IS NOT BUILT, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING.
8. CLIENT CONTRACTOR TO CONSTRUCT SLAB DIMENSIONS UNDER ORDERING MATERIAL & SUBCONTRACT.
CONCRETE:
1. ALL CONCRETE ON THIS PROJECT SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM OF 28 DAY COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 30 MPa WITH AIR ENTRAINMENT AND 0.45 MAX WATER-TO-CEMENT RATIO.
2. ALL REINFORCEMENT IS TO BE GRADE 400W.
3. REBAR SPLICE LENGTH TO BAR LAP.
WELDED WIRE MESH: 15M, 10M, 10M LAP.
4. ALL CONCRETE WORK SHALL BE CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE TO THE LATEST EDITION OF THE NATIONAL BUILDING CODE, CAN/CSA A23.1-23.2 AND LOCAL BY-LAWS.
5. CONCRETE SHALL BE POURED IN THE FOLLOWING MANNER:
   a) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. FOOTINGS).
   b) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. SIDE OF THE FLOATING SLAB).
6. SLAB ON GRADE SHALL BE FORMED OF GRANULAR 'A' FILL COMPACTED TO 95% SPD).
7. SLIP JOINTS RECOMMENDED FOR ALL UTILITY CONNECTIONS.
REVIEW OF FLOATING SLABS:
IF REVIEW IS SIGNED OFF OF THE FLOATING SLAB IS REQUIRED, PROVIDE PHOTOS OF THE FOLLOWING ITEMS TO WADDELL ENGINEERING LTD. (WEL) FOR REVIEW BEFORE CONCRETE IS POURED:
- EXCAVATION
- FORMS (INCLUDING A TAPE MEASURE FOR...
pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet provides a comprehensive overview of the foundation design for a floating slab, including detailed notes on foundation preparation, concrete specifications, and reinforcement requirements. It includes a plan view of the floating slab layout and sections detailing the thickened edges and intermediate strip footings. The general notes emphasize the importance of proper soil preparation and concrete placement to ensure structural integrity. The sheet also outlines review procedures for the floating slab construction, highlighting the need for photographic documentation before concrete pouring.
